item.title: Tracy add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Tracy add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Bret Harte
item.description: "The only sure thing about luck is that it will change. " -- Bret Harte

item.title: Tracy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tracy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tracy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tracy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tracy add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "People disappear when they die. Their voice, their laughter, the warmth of their breath. Their flesh. Eventually their bones. All living memory of them ceases. This is both dreadful and natural. Yet for some there is an exception to this annihilation. For in the books they write they continue to exist. We can rediscover them. Their humor, their tone of voice, their moods. Through the written word they can anger you or make you happy. They can comfort you. They can perplex you. They can alter you. All this, even though they are dead. Like flies in amber, like corpses frozen in the ice, that which according to the laws of nature should pass away is, by the miracle of ink on paper, preserved. It is a kind of magic." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses donâ€™t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.
